intro: Hirnellia nuda, commonly known as the naked hirnellia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on tropical flora and pollination ecology.
